name: hicops

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: timemory
variants.description: Enable timemory interface. Requires timemory installation.

variants.name: mpip
variants.description: Enables the MPIP data_tracker via Timemory. Requires timemory installation.

variants.name: tailfit
variants.description: Use the tailfit method instead of Gumbelfit for e-value computation.

variants.name: qalen
variants.description: Maximum number of top K peaks to keep when spectrum preprocess.

variants.name: qchunk
variants.description: Max size of each batch extracted from the dataset.

variants.name: shdpeaks
variants.description: Maximum shared b- or y-ions allowed.

description:
HiCOPS is a software framework for accelerating database peptide search
workflows on supercomputers. HiCOPS provided algorithm-independent
parallelizations and optimizations can be extended into new HPC database
search algorithms or scalably accelerate the existing ones.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-python-dateutil
dependencies.description: Extensions to the standard Python datetime module.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-bottleneck
dependencies.description: A collection of fast NumPy array functions written in Cython.

dependencies.name: py-pyparsing
dependencies.description: A Python Parsing Module.

dependencies.name: py-six
dependencies.description: Python 2 and 3 compatibility utilities.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm
dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.

dependencies.name: py-et-xmlfile
dependencies.description: An implementation of lxml.xmlfile for the standard library.

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: py-cycler
dependencies.description: Composable style cycles.

dependencies.name: py-pytz
dependencies.description: World timezone definitions, modern and historical.

dependencies.name: py-kiwisolver
dependencies.description: A fast implementation of the Cassowary constraint solver

dependencies.name: py-numexpr
dependencies.description: Fast numerical expression evaluator for NumPy

dependencies.name: py-matplotlib
dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: py-jdcal
dependencies.description: Julian dates from proleptic Gregorian and Julian calendars

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-openpyxl
dependencies.description: A Python library to read/write Excel 2010 xlsx/xlsm files

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: boost
dependencies.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.

dependencies.name: mpich
dependencies.description:
MPICH is a high performance and widely portable implementation of the
Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard.

dependencies.name: git
dependencies.description:
Git is a free and open source distributed version control system
designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with
speed and efficiency.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.
